FuncDef: The display tcp ipv6 status command displays all IPv6 TCP connections. The display tcp ipv6 status command displays all IPv6 TCP connections. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: display tcp ipv6 status [ local-ip <local-ip> | local-port <local-port> | remote-ip <remote-ip> | remote-port <remote-port> ] [ cid <cid> ] [ socket-id <socket-id> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays the IPv6 TCP connection with a specified local IP address.
The address is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Displays the IPv6 TCP connection with a specified local port number.
The value ranges from 0 to 65535.

Displays the IPv6 TCP connection with a specified remote IP address.
The address is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Displays the IPv6 TCP connection with a specified remote port number.
The value ranges from 0 to 65535.

Displays the IPv6 TCP connection with a specified APP CID.
The value is a hexadecimal integer that ranges from 0 to ffffffff.

Displays the IPv6 TCP connection with a specified socket ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 2147418111.

ExtraInfo: TCP defined in standard protocols ensures high-reliability transmission between hosts. TCP provides reliable, connection-oriented, and full-duplex services for user processes. To monitor the TCP connection status, run the display tcp status command to check the following information:
